member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Drawing.BitmapEx
member.summary: Encapsulates a GDI+ bitmap, which consists of the pixel data for a graphics image and its attributes. A BitmapEx object is an object used to work with images defined by pixel data.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Drawing.BitmapEx.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BitmapEx class with the specified size.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Drawing.BitmapEx.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Drawing.Bitmap class from the specified file.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Drawing.BitmapEx.GetHbitmap
member.summary: Creates a GDI bitmap object from this BitmapEx object.
member.returns: A handle to the GDI bitmap object that this method creates.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Drawing.BitmapEx.LockBits(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat)
member.summary: BitmapEx object into system memory.
member.param: A System.Drawing.Rectangle structure specifying the portion of the BitmapEx to lock.
Access level (read and write) for the BitmapEx object. >
PixelFormat enumeration specifying the data format of this BitmapEx object.
member.returns: BitmapData object containing information about this lock operation.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Drawing.BitmapEx.UnlockBits(OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData)
member.summary: Unlocks this BitmapEx from system memory.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Drawing.BitmapEx.Width
member.summary: Gets the width of this BitmapEx object.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Drawing.BitmapEx.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of this BitmapEx object.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData
member.summary: Specifies the attributes of a bitmap image. The BitmapData class is used by the LockBits and UnlockBits methods of the BitmapEx class.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData.PixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the pixel information.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData.Scan0
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the first pixel data in the bitmap.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData.Stride
member.summary: Gets or sets the stride width (also called scan width) of the bitmap object.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the pixel width of the BitmapEx object. This can also be thought of as the number of pixels in one scan line.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the pixel height of the BitmapEx object.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2
member.summary: Specifies alignment of content on the drawing surface.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2.BottomCenter
member.summary: Content is vertically aligned at the bottom, and horizontally aligned at the center.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2.BottomLeft
member.summary: Content is vertically aligned at the bottom, and horizontally aligned on the left.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2.BottomRight
member.summary: Content is vertically aligned at the bottom, and horizontally aligned on the right.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2.MiddleCenter
member.summary: Content is vertically aligned in the middle, and horizontally aligned at the center.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2.MiddleLeft
member.summary: Content is vertically aligned in the middle, and horizontally aligned on the left.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2.MiddleRight
member.summary: Content is vertically aligned in the middle, and horizontally aligned on the right.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2.TopCenter
member.summary: Content is vertically aligned at the top, and horizontally aligned at the center.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2.TopLeft
member.summary: Content is vertically aligned at the top, and horizontally aligned on the left.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ContentAlignment2.TopRight
member.summary: Content is vertically aligned at the top, and horizontally aligned on the right.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation
member.summary: Determines how the source color in a copy pixel operation is combined with the destination color to result in a final color.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.Blackness
member.summary: The destination area is filled by using the color associated with index 0 in the physical palette. (This color is black for the default physical palette.)

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.CaptureBlt
member.summary: Windows that are layered on top of your window are included in the resulting image. By default, the image contains only your window. Note that this generally cannot be used for printing device contexts.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.DestinationInvert
member.summary: The destination area is inverted.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.MergeCopy
member.summary: The colors of the source area are merged with the colors of the selected brush of the destination device context using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.MergePaint
member.summary: The colors of the inverted source area are merged with the colors of the destination area by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.NoMirrorBitmap
member.summary: The bitmap is not mirrored.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.NotSourceCopy
member.summary: The inverted source area is copied to the destination.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.NotSourceErase
member.summary: The source and destination colors are combined using the Boolean OR operator, and then resultant color is then inverted.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.PatCopy
member.summary: The brush currently selected in the destination device context is copied to the destination bitmap.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.PatInvert
member.summary: The colors of the brush currently selected in the destination device context are combined with the colors of the destination are using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.PatPaint
member.summary: The colors of the brush currently selected in the destination device context are combined with the colors of the inverted source area using the Boolean OR operator. The result of this operation is combined with the colors of the destination area using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourceAnd
member.summary: The colors of the source and destination areas are combined using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourceCopy
member.summary: The source area is copied directly to the destination area.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourceErase
member.summary: The inverted colors of the destination area are combined with the colors of the source area using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourceInvert
member.summary: The colors of the source and destination areas are combined using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourcePaint
member.summary: The colors of the source and destination areas are combined using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.Whiteness
member.summary: The destination area is filled by using the color associated with index 1 in the physical palette. (This color is white for the default physical palette.)

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Drawing.ColorTranslator.ToHtml(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Translates the specified structure to an HTML string color representation.
member.param: The structure to translate.
member.returns: The string that represents the HTML color.
member.remarks: Unlike the desktop version of this function it does not check for named colors but instead always returns the hex notation values - e.g. Color.Red = "#FF0000"

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.IImage
member.summary: This is the basic interface to an image object. It allows applications to do the following: Display the image onto a destination graphics context Push image data into an image sink Access image properties and metadata Decoded image objects and in-memory bitmap image objects support the IImage interface

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.IImage.GetPhysicalDimension(System.Drawing.Size@)
member.summary: Get the device-independent physical dimension of the image unit of 0.01mm

member.summary: Get a thumbnail representation for the image object

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.IImageDecoder
member.summary: This is a low-level interface to an image decoder object. Many simple applications do not need to work with decoder objects directly and can work with higher level decoded image objects instead. More sophisticated applications can use the IImageDecoder interface to have finer control over the interaction with decoder objects. The IImageDecoder interface can support images with multiple frames. Multiframe images are accessed via multidimensional indices. This interface can support an arbitrary number of dimensions in nonrectangular arrangements

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.IImageSink
member.summary: This interface allows an image source, such as an image decoder, and an image sink to exchange data. The most important interaction between the source and the sink happens when they negotiate data transfer parameters during the call to the IImageSink::BeginSink method

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.TAG_TYPE
member.summary: Property tag types

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.TAG_TYPE.BYTE
member.summary: 8-bit unsigned int

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.TAG_TYPE.ASCII
member.summary: 8-bit byte containing one 7-bit ASCII code. NULL terminated.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.TAG_TYPE.SHORT
member.summary: 16-bit unsigned int

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.TAG_TYPE.LONG
member.summary: 32-bit unsigned int

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.TAG_TYPE.RATIONAL
member.summary: Two LONGs. The first LONG is the numerator, the second LONG expresses the denominator.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.TAG_TYPE.UNDEFINED
member.summary: 8-bit byte that can take any value depending on field definition

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.TAG_TYPE.SLONG
member.summary: 32-bit singed integer (2's complement notation)

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.Imaging.TAG_TYPE.SRATIONAL
member.summary: Two SLONGs. First is numerator, second is the denominator

member.summary: Specifies the direction of an image's rotation and the axis used to flip the image.

member.summary: Specifies a 180-degree rotation followed by a horizontal and vertical flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.RotateNoneFlipNone
member.summary: Specifies no rotation and no flipping.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate270FlipXY
member.summary: Specifies a 270-degree rotation followed by a horizontal and vertical flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate90FlipNone
member.summary: Specifies a 90-degree rotation without flipping.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate180FlipNone
member.summary: Specifies a 180-degree rotation without flipping.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.RotateNoneFlipXY
member.summary: Specifies no rotation followed by a horizontal and vertical flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate270FlipNone
member.summary: Specifies a 270-degree rotation without flipping.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate90FlipXY
member.summary: Specifies a 90-degree rotation followed by a horizontal and vertical flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate180FlipY
member.summary: Specifies a 180-degree rotation followed by a vertical flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.RotateNoneFlipX
member.summary: Specifies no rotation followed by a horizontal flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate90FlipX
member.summary: Specifies a 90-degree rotation followed by a horizontal flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate270FlipY
member.summary: Specifies a 270-degree rotation followed by a vertical flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.RotateNoneFlipY
member.summary: Specifies no rotation followed by a vertical flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate180FlipX
member.summary: Specifies a 180-degree rotation followed by a horizontal flip.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate90FlipY

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Drawing.RotateFlipType.Rotate270FlipX

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapFileHeader
member.summary: This structure contains information about the type, size, and layout of a file that containing a device-independent bitmap (DIB).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapFileHeader.Type
member.summary: Specifies the file type. It must be BM.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapFileHeader.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the bitmap file.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapFileHeader.OffBits
member.summary: Specifies the offset, in bytes, from the BitmapFileHeader structure to the bitmap bits.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapFileHeader.Data
member.summary: Internal data

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader
member.summary: Contains information about the dimensions and color format of a device-independent bitmap (DIB).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.Size
member.summary: Specifies the number of bytes required by the structure.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the bitmap, in pixels. If biHeight is positive, the bitmap is a bottom-up DIB and its origin is the lower-left corner. If biHeight is negative, the bitmap is a top-down DIB and its origin is the upper-left corner. If biHeight is negative, indicating a top-down DIB, biCompression must be either BI_RGB or BI_BITFIELDS. Top-down DIBs cannot be compressed.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.Planes
member.summary: Specifies the number of planes for the target device. This value must be set to 1.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.BitCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of bits per pixel. The biBitCount member determines the number of bits that define each pixel and the maximum number of colors in the bitmap.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.Compression
member.summary: Specifies the type of compression for a compressed bottom-up bitmap (top-down DIBs cannot be compressed).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.SizeImage
member.summary: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the image. This may be set to zero for BI_RGB bitmaps.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.XPelsPerMeter
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal resolution, in pixels per meter, of the target device for the bitmap. An application can use this value to select a bitmap from a resource group that best matches the characteristics of the current device.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.YPelsPerMeter
member.summary: Specifies the vertical resolution, in pixels per meter, of the target device for the bitmap

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.ClrUsed
member.summary: Specifies the number of color indexes in the color table that are actually used by the bitmap. If this value is zero, the bitmap uses the maximum number of colors corresponding to the value of the biBitCount member for the compression mode specified by biCompression.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Win32.BitmapInfoHeader.ClrImportant
member.summary: Specifies the number of color indexes required for displaying the bitmap. If this value is zero, all colors are required.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.DibSection
member.summary: Wrapper for WIN32 DIBSECTION structure

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.DibSection.bmType
member.summary: Specifies the bitmap type; set to zero.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.DibSection.bmWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width, in pixels, of the bitmap. The width must be greater than zero.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.DibSection.bmHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height, in pixels, of the bitmap. The height must be greater than zero.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.DibSection.bmWidthBytes
member.summary: Specifies the number of bytes in each scan line. This value must be divisible by 2, because the system assumes that the bit values of a bitmap form an array that is word aligned.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.DibSection.bmBits
member.summary: Pointer to the location of the bit values for the bitmap. The bmBits member must be a long pointer to an array of character (1-byte) values.

a buffer that is to receive the information about the specified graphics object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, and lpvObject is a valid pointer, the return value is the number of bytes stored into the buffer.

Specifies the number of bytes of information to be written to the buffer.
a buffer that is to receive the information about the specified graphics object.
